div.p: Most illustrious and distinguished man, our dearest and most esteemed friend and lord.
We offer our sincere goodwill and every kind of service to your most excellent lordship.

When the young man of noble birth, the honorable and magnificent Lord Johannes Kysska, Palatine of Witebsk, free baron in Cziechanowyecz, lord in Tivye and Losko, decided to travel to Germany for the sake of acquiring virtue and proper education, following our advice, he resolved to first see your republic and the school in Zurich and to spend time there.

Therefore, we did not want to neglect, due to our affection and duty towards your excellence and the goodwill established through mutual letters, to commend this young man to your excellence, so that you may favor him with your goodwill and support, and whatever kindness and hospitality you may extend to him, we will regard and accept it as if this service were rendered to us or to our little son, who not long ago was also sent to you.
Furthermore, we wish your excellence good health and the greatest increase of all good fortunes.

Given in Vilnius on the 26th day of August in the year of our Lord 1563. Your most excellent lordship's good friend, Nikolaus Radziwill, by the grace of God Duke in Olyka and Nieswiez, lord in Kleczko and Grodek, Palatine of Vilnius, Grand Marshal of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, and Archchancellor of Brzesc, Kaunas, Borisov, and General Captain in Great Schawlye, etc., signed with his own hand.

To the most illustrious and learned man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, most vigilant pastor of the Church of Zurich and most worthy superintendent of the Swiss churches, our dearest and most esteemed friend.
